SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am49.server.model.cards.placeables

Class PlaceableCard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am49.server.model.cards.Card
it.polimi.ingsw.am49.server.model.cards.placeables.PlaceableCard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
GoldCard, ResourceCard, StarterCard
public abstract class PlaceableCard extends Card implements Serializable
Represents the cards that can be placed on the player board. This abstract class provides the common methods for all the types of placeable cards.
See Also:
  • StarterCard
  • ResourceCard
  • GoldCard
  • Serialized Form

  • Field Details

    • tr

      protected final Symbol tr
      The symbol present in the top right corner of the card's front.

    • tl

      protected final Symbol tl
      The symbol present in the top left corner of the card's front.

    • br

      protected final Symbol br
      The symbol present in the bottom right corner of the card's front.

    • bl

      protected final Symbol bl
      The symbol present in the bottom left corner of the card's front.

    • flipped

      protected boolean flipped
      Is true if the card is placed flipped on the player board.

    • resource

      protected final Resource resource
      The resource the card belongs to

    • points

      protected final int points
      The amount of points given to the player assuming the condition shown on the card is accomplished a single time. In order to get the points the player must place this card with the face showing the accomplishments facing up.

    • price

      protected final Map<Symbol,Integer> price
      Is representing the required resources that must be on the player board if the player wants to place the card's face showing the price.

    • pointsStrategy

      protected final PlacementPointsStrategy pointsStrategy
      Object used to call the strategy design pattern.

    • isGoldCard

      protected boolean isGoldCard
      Used to easily check if a card is a gold card

  • Constructor Details

    • PlaceableCard

      public PlaceableCard(int id, Symbol tr, Symbol tl, Symbol br, Symbol bl, Resource resource, int points, PlacementPointsStrategy pointsStrategy, Map<Symbol,Integer> price, boolean isGoldCard)
      Constructs a new PlaceableCard object with the specified symbols in the corners and identified by id.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the card
      tr - the symbol in the top right corner of the card's front
      tl - the symbol in the top left corner of the card's front
      br - the symbol in the bottom right corner of the card's front
      bl - the symbol in the bottom left corner of the card's front
      resource - the resource the card belongs to
      points - the amount of points given to the player assuming the condition shown on the card is accomplished a single time
      pointsStrategy - object used to call the strategy design pattern

  • Method Details

    • calculatePoints

      public int calculatePoints(PlayerBoard playerBoard, BoardTile boardTile)
      Calculates the total amount of points given to the player, considering the number of times the condition shown on the card is accomplished.
      Parameters:
      playerBoard - the whole player board, containing all the already placed cards
      boardTile - the object of type BoardTile representing the tile in which the card is placed
      Returns:
      the total points the player gets from placing the card

    • getResource

      public Resource getResource()
      Returns:
      the resource the card belongs to

    • getPrice

      public Map<Symbol,Integer> getPrice()
      Returns:
      the required resources that must be on the player board if the player wants to place the card's face showing the price

    • getPoints

      public int getPoints()
      Returns:
      the amount of points given to the player assuming the condition shown on the card is accomplished a single time

    • getTr

      public Symbol getTr()
      Returns:
      the symbol in the top right corner of the card's front

    • getTl

      public Symbol getTl()
      Returns:
      the symbol in the top left corner of the card's front

    • getBr

      public Symbol getBr()
      Returns:
      the symbol in the bottom right corner of the card's front

    • getBl

      public Symbol getBl()
      Returns:
      the symbol in the bottom left corner of the card's front

    • getActiveTr

      public Symbol getActiveTr()
      Gets the symbol in the top right corner that is visible looking at the player board.
      Returns:
      the symbol in the top right corner of the card's front if isn't flipped, the symbol in the top right corner of the card's back otherwise

    • getActiveTl

      public Symbol getActiveTl()
      Gets the symbol in the top left corner that is visible looking at the player board.
      Returns:
      the symbol in the top left corner of the card's front if isn't flipped, the symbol in the top left corner of the card's back otherwise

    • getActiveBr

      public Symbol getActiveBr()
      Gets the symbol in the bottom right corner that is visible looking at the player board.
      Returns:
      the symbol in the bottom right corner of the card's front if isn't flipped, the symbol in the bottom right corner of the card's back otherwise

    • getActiveBl

      public Symbol getActiveBl()
      Gets the symbol in the bottom left corner that is visible looking at the player board.
      Returns:
      the symbol in the bottom left corner of the card's front if it isn't flipped, the symbol in the bottom left corner of the card's back otherwise

    • getActiveCenterResources

      public List<Resource> getActiveCenterResources()
      Gets the resources in the center of the card's face that is visible looking at the player board. If there aren't any resources the list returned is empty.
      Returns:
      the list of resources visible in the center of the card once placed

    • getCenterResources

      public List<Resource> getCenterResources()
      Gets the resources in the center of the only card's face where there actually are some resources. The front in the case of StarterCard's cards. The back in the case of ResourceCard's and GoldCard's cards.
      Returns:
      the list of mentioned resources

    • isFlipped

      public boolean isFlipped()
      Returns:
      true if the card on the player board is placed flipped, false otherwise

    • setFlipped

      public void setFlipped(boolean flipped)
      Parameters:
      flipped - sets the orientation of the card

    • isGoldCard

      public boolean isGoldCard()
      Returns:
      the value of isGoldCard
